MCQ: What is the primary concern of the field of Machine Learning?
Choices: a: Developing algorithms that can perform tasks with explicit instructions | b: Developing statistical algorithms that can learn from data and generalize to unseen data | c: Developing artificial neural networks that can surpass human performance | d: Developing predictive models that require human intervention

MCQ: What has been able to surpass many previous approaches in performance in Machine Learning?
Choices: a: Artificial neural networks | b: Decision Trees | c: Support Vector Machines | d: Random Forests

MCQ: What is the application of Machine Learning in business problems known as?
Choices: a: Predictive Analytics | b: Descriptive Analytics | c: Prescriptive Analytics | d: Diagnostic Analytics

MCQ: What is the field of study that focuses on exploratory data analysis through unsupervised learning?
Choices: a: Data Mining | b: Machine Learning | c: Artificial Intelligence | d: Deep Learning

MCQ: What provides the mathematical foundations of Machine Learning?
Choices: a: Mathematical Optimization | b: Computational Statistics | c: Probability Theory | d: Linear Algebra

MCQ: What is the framework that provides a theoretical viewpoint for describing Machine Learning?
Choices: a: PAC Learning | b: Probably Correct Learning | c: Approximately Correct Learning | d: Likely Correct Learning

MCQ: What is the type of learning that is used in data mining?
Choices: a: Supervised Learning | b: Unsupervised Learning | c: Reinforcement Learning | d: Deep Learning

MCQ: What is the field of study that is concerned with the development and study of statistical algorithms that can learn from data?
Choices: a: Artificial Intelligence | b: Machine Learning | c: Deep Learning | d: Natural Language Processing

MCQ: What is the application of Machine Learning in the field of healthcare?
Choices: a: Medicine | b: Agriculture | c: Computer Vision | d: Speech Recognition

MCQ: What is the importance of computational statistics in Machine Learning?
Choices: a: It is not important at all | b: It is a minor source of methods | c: It is an important source of methods | d: It is the only source of methods
